name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgments in these cases are affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Hargest in the preceding case, No. 20, May Term, 1935, and upon our ruling in Com. v. Schuylkill Trust Co., 315 Pa. 429.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Geo. Ross Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MacCoy, Brittain, Evans & Lewis and Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, for appellant.
Philip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. Provident Trust Company of Philadelphia
(No. 4).
June 29, 1935:
Geo. Ross Hull, of Snyder, Hull, Hull & Leiby, with him MacCoy, Brittain, Evans & Lewis and Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, for appellant.
Philip S. Moyer, with him Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellee.
